content:
That's a great plan! Reaching out to the instructor or team members is a wonderful way to get a better understanding of their style and preferences. They might even be able to share their own playlist or give you some insider tips on what to expect.

By asking for their recommendations, you'll also show that you're interested in learning and adapting to their style, which can be a great way to build a connection with the team.

While you're waiting to hear back from them, searching for popular hip hop tracks and dance fitness playlists is a great way to get a feel for the genre and rhythm. You can also try searching for playlists on music streaming platforms like Spotify, Apple Music, or YouTube Music using keywords like "hip hop dance workout," "dance fitness," or "hip hop choreography."

Some popular playlists on Spotify that might give you an idea of the style and rhythm include:

* "Hip Hop Workout" by Spotify
* "Dance Fitness" by Fitness Blender
* "Hip Hop Choreography" by STEEZY Studio
* "Cardio Hip Hop" by PopSugar Fitness

Remember, the goal is to get a feel for the style and rhythm, not to exactly replicate the team's playlist. By doing your research and showing your enthusiasm, you'll be well-prepared to join the team and learn their choreography.

Good luck, and I hope you have fun exploring the world of hip hop dance!
